PIONEER DIET: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask. where it will be preserved as part of the permanent record of our Province.

Name: Mrs. Regina Peterson
Address: Stockholm, Sask.
Birthplace: Sweden

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1894
Where did you set up housekeeping? Stockholm, Colony, near Stockholm.
Where had you been living before that? Richardson, Canada.
For how many people did you prepare meals? 8
How far was it to your nearest store? 25 miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Once or twice a month.
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Coffee, sugar, tea, salt, and sometimes a small pail syrup.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? XXXX Brand
In what quantities did you buy it? One or two bags at a time.
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? $2.00
How much did you use graham flour? Didn't use any
Whole wheat flour? About one or two bags per year
Was flour milled locally? Yes, after far away? 25 miles
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? Didn't remember
What other grain products did you use? Rye flour
Cornmeal? Oats Whole Wheat? None Farina? None
Other?
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? No
How did you grind it?

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner and supper) for the earliest year (your own, remember). Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Western Canada? Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at the time.

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

No, we always had plenty of game, fresh bread and butter.
